    • Field Detail

      • argumentList

        public List<CommandLineArgument> argumentList

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgumentParser

        public ArgumentParser()
        Class constructor. Establishes an empty argumentList and an empty list of required arguments.

        Optional argument "help" is available by default.

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns a number representing the number of positional arguments and optional arguments within the argumentList.
        Returns:
        the size of the argument list as an integer value

      • setMutualGroup

        public void setMutualGroup(int num,
                  String... args)
                    throws InvalidGroupException
        Parameters:
        num - the number of the mutual group the argument is to be placed in
        args - the value(s) to be put into the mutual group
        Throws:
        InvalidGroupException - - if an invalid group number is entered

      • getMutualGroup

        public String getMutualGroup(int num)
                      throws InvalidGroupException
        Returns the values contained in the specified mutually exclusive group.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of the mutual group
        Returns:
        the members of the mutual group as a string value
        Throws:
        InvalidGroupException - - if an invalid group number is entered

      • addRestricted

        public void addRestricted(String title,
                 Object... args)
                   throws IncorrectTypeException
        Sets the argument to only accept a set of restricted values. Multiple values can be added(separated by a comma).
        Parameters:
        title - the name of the argument
        args - the value(s) the argument is restricted to
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - - if an incorrect data type is entered for the argument

      • checkRestricted

        public String checkRestricted(String title)
        Returns a list of the values an argument is restricted to.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the argument
        Returns:
        the values the argument is restricted to

        public void addArgument(String title,
               CommandLineArgument.DataType type)
        Adds a new argument to the list of arguments and sets the data type that argument can hold.
        Parameters:

        type - the data type of the argument

      • setShortOption

        public void setShortOption(String title,
                  String str)
        Sets a short name to an optional argument which allows the optional argument to be called by either it's full name or the declared short name.
        Parameters:
        title - the name of the argument
        str - the short name to be attached to the argument

      • getShortOption

        public String getShortOption(String title)
        Returns the short name if one has been assigned to the argument. This is used for generating the help text.
        Parameters:
        title - the name of the argument
        Returns:
        the short option associated with the argument

      • addOptionalArgument

        public void addOptionalArgument(String title,
                       CommandLineArgument.DataType type)
        Adds a new optional argument to the argument list with a specified data type.

        Accepted Data Types: Boolean, Float, String, Integer

        Parameters:
        title - - the title of the optional argument
        type - - the data type of the optional argument

      • addOptionalArgument

        public void addOptionalArgument(String title)
        Adds a new optional argument to the argument list.
        Parameters:
        title - name of the optional argument

      • setDefaultValue

        public void setDefaultValue(String title,
                   String value)
        Sets a default value to an argument that will be used if no other value is assigned to the argument.
        Parameters:
        title - the name of the argument
        value - the desired default value of the argument

      • setValue

        public void setValue(String... args)
              throws IncorrectTypeException,
                     IncorrectValueException
        Sets the value(s) of the argument.
        Parameters:
        args - the value(s) of the referenced optional argument or the next positional argument; the first value to be passed in the title of the argument
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - - if the data type does not match the data type of the argument
        IncorrectValueException - - if the value does not match the restricted values

        public void setDescription(String title,
                  String description)

        Parameters:
        title - the name of the argument
        description - - the description of the argument

      • parse

        public void parse(String str)
           throws NotEnoughArgValuesException,
                  TooManyArgValuesException,
                  IncorrectTypeException,
                  IncorrectValueException,
                  InvalidGroupException
        Parses the string passed in through the Command Line.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to be parsed
        Throws:
        NotEnoughArgValuesException - - if the amount of values parsed does not match the number of required arguments
        TooManyArgValuesException - - if the amount of values parsed exceeds the number of required arguments
        IncorrectTypeException - - if the data type of a value does not match the data type of the argument
        IncorrectValueException - - if the value does not match the restricted values of an argument
        InvalidGroupException

      • setPass

        public void setPass(String title)
        Sets which group the first mutually exclusive argument comes from.
        Parameters:
        title - the name of the argument

      • getNextArgumentNumberValues

        public int getNextArgumentNumberValues()
        Returns the number of values required for the next free argument.
        Returns:
        the number of values from the first not used argument

      • getHelpText

        public String getHelpText()
        Returns the help text for the program.
        Returns:
        the formatted help text of the program and arguments

      • getOutput

        public String getOutput()
        Returns the XML notation of the argument list for use in creating XML save data.
        Returns:
        the XML notation of the argument list
